name: English Bay
description:
Standing on the Granville Island Market wooden plank parking lot  looking north towards the Heart Of Vancouver.  To the left is the Burrard St. Bridge, then the buildings located on Beach ave. and beyond.  To the Right, Granville St. Bridge and the Market itself.   This painting measures in at over 60” wide and 30” high.  It was painted on three full sized sheets of watercolour paper. 

This piece is on 300lb cold press archival paper.

Framing by request and at an additional charge. Please email me for more information.

name: Jericho
description:
From Jericho Beach you experience the man-made beauty that is Vancouver.  Surrounded by majestic mountains in the North, a fertile Fraser Valley in the east and the expansive Pacific ocean in the west. I would be no where else. This is my Home.  

Jericho Beach Watercolour on 300lb coldpress archival paper.

Framing by request and at an additional charge. Please email me for more information.

name: Midnight Run
description:
Midnight Run: Watercolour on 300lb coldpress archival paper

Painted from a photography I took from Stanley Park. The Harbour opens up in front of you; Canada Place and the Vancouver Convention Center illuminate the inlet. It was after midnight, a few days before the 2010 Winter Olympics. You could feel the  energy in the air. 

18"x28"

Unframed. Framing optional. email me and I can get you a quote.

name: Olympic Blues
description:
A few weeks before Vancouver hosted the 2010 Winter Olympics back in February, I ventured into the city to capture it in quiet anticipation. Vancouver hummed with excitement. It vibrated like a City just about to go global. All Eyes were on us.

Olympic Blues was painted from a photo I took from Stanley Park looking south east towards the dock yards and Burnaby Mountain. 

This piece is 24"x30", on 300lb cold press archival paper.

Framing by request and at an additional charge. Please email me for more information.

name: Columbia River - Castelgar bridge
description:
This piece was inspired by a boat ride up the Columbia river in the summer of 2009. I was visiting a good friend in Trail/Roseland in the Kootneys of British columbia. We went for a ride in his cousins boat. It was one of the most entertaining days I have had in a long time. It was exhilarating.

The piece is 22"X12", it is on 300lbs cold press watercolour paper.

Please contact me if you would like a quote for Framing and Matting.
